summary: This is a standard Office of the Inspector General (OIG) form used to document an employee's voluntary agreement to be interviewed as part of an investigation. The form includes warnings and assurances about the voluntary nature of the interview and the potential use of statements in future proceedings. The specific subject of the investigation is not clearly stated in the provided text.

persons.name: C. Rcook
persons.role: Special Agent, Office of the Inspector General
persons.context: Appears as the signing Special Agent for the Office of the Inspector General on the interview waiver form.

keyFacts: The document is a voluntary interview waiver form from the U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG).
The form states the interview is voluntary, no disciplinary action will be taken for refusing to answer, and any statements may be used in future criminal or disciplinary proceedings.
The specific subject of the OIG investigation is not clearly legible in the provided text fragment.
The form is signed by a Special Agent named C. Rcook and a witness, though the witness's name is not fully legible.
The document is part of the Epstein case files, suggesting the OIG investigation pertained to matters related to Jeffrey Epstein.
